subject: RE: [junit] help
msgSnippet: I think you can add a getter method for x and check the value using assertEquals() method. For example, class Sample { ... public int getX() { return x; } }
messageBody:
I think you can add a getter method for 'x' and check the value using
assertEquals() method.
For example,
class Sample {
...
public int getX() {
return x;
}
}

and in the Test Class, add the following Method

public void testChangeX() {
Sample s = new Sample();
s.change();
assertEquals(10, s.getX());
}

Now, the Test done!!

- Jaewoo

-----Original Message-----
From: santu nand [mailto:sknanda9@...]
Sent: Wednesday, August 25, 2004 8:07 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] help


can anyone tell me how to test a a public datamember which returns
nothing and its all acting upon private data members only.

For ex:

class sample

{

private int x;

public void change()

{

x=10;

}

}

Now is it possible to test this change method???



-Santanu
